column2: NEBRASKA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Nebraska
column6: NE

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column6: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column10: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.

column2: 2. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Call an ambulance.
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column10: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 3. Motorists are not required to yield to pedestrians when approaching or exiting a roundabout.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 4. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: a divided highway ends ahead.
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column10: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.

column2: 5. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Brake lightly.
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 6. When planning to leave the interstate, you should:
column4: slow down to 35 MPH or less.
column6: signal and move into the proper lane a mile or more before the exit.
column8: signal 50 feet prior to the exit ramp.

column2: 7. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: direct drivers to services.
column8: give information about directions and distances.
column10: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 8. Which of the following factors affect the absorption of alcohol?
column4: Your race.
column6: Your height.

column2: 9. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 10. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.
column6: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.

column2: 11. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: maximum speed
column6: suggested speed

column2: 12. When approaching a blind person walking with a white cane or guide dog, drivers should yield the right-of-way.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 13. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Upside-down triangle
column6: Octagon

column2: 14. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 15. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column8: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 16. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway ends ahead.
column6: Divided highway ahead.
column10: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 17. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Stop, yield the right-of-way, then go.

column2: 18. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.
column8: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.

column2: 19. When passing a vehicle,  it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you just passed signals you over.
column6: you look over your shoulder and see no vehicle behind you.
column8: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror.

column2: 20. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 21. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column6: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 22. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column4: white; black
column6: yellow; black

column2: 23. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 24. When making an emergency stop, drivers should:
column4: slam on the brakes and steer in the direction you want to go.
column6: activate the emergency flashers before pulling over to the side of the road.
column8: shift to the proper gear and set parking brake.

column2: 25. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: stop much more slowly
column6: stop much more quickly
